name: main street headband
notes:
**all my paid patterns are 20% off (no code needed!) through 12/2/25 at 11:59pm est!**

if you’re learning to knit you can make this adorable, giftable headband with just one ball of yarn, one set of needles, and 5 skills: casting on, the knit stitch, slipped stitches, binding off, and a little bit of creative sewing.

this beginner-friendly pattern was inspired by one of the local farm yarns close to our shop and it works up just beautifully! there are notes for making different sizes and widths and you can work that 50-100g skein you’ve been saving into a gorgeous statement piece for yourself, or work up a bunch as gifts for friends, teachers, bus drivers, or donations!

**materials**
*yarn*: 
under the rainbow 2-ply dk (265yds/100g) (sample used about 40g)
or 1 skein of dk weight yarn (100g)

*needles*: us 6 (4.0mm) needles or size needed to obtain gauge

*notions*: darning needle, scissors, measuring tape

*gauge*: 20 sts & 36 rows/4” in garter stitch after blocking.

*sizing*: one size* (9.75” x 4.5” after seaming when laid flat)
*to adjust width: cast on more or fewer stitches. to adjust length: knit more or fewer rows. (work until about 2” shorter than the desired head circumference.)
